explainability.findings: Partnership announcements mention an AI system and its interpretable nature. These announcements detail the system's capabilities and purpose.
explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

relevant_sources.summary: This partnership announcement provides evidence for the **explainability** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports explainability by mentioning an "AI system" and its "interpretable" nature, detailing its capabilities and purpose. The document also supports transparency by describing these functionalities, allowing for an understanding of how the tire intelligence technology operates within Gatik's autonomous fleet.
relevant_sources.title: Gatik Strategic Partnership with Goodyear - Tire Intelligence

external_accountability.findings: Press releases position the company's technology as meeting and exceeding regulatory requirements for safety.
external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

relevant_sources.summary: This press release, "Goodyear-TNO Automatic Emergency Braking System Integration," provides evidence for **external accountability**, **governance**, and **transparency**. It demonstrates transparency by detailing how tire intelligence enables smarter AEB decision-making and highlights external accountability by positioning the technology as meeting and exceeding regulatory requirements for safety. The press release also implies governance through its aims to predict braking distance and trigger AEB for safety, showcasing a commitment to safety and the role of AEB systems in automated driving.
relevant_sources.title: Goodyear-TNO Automatic Emergency Braking System Integration

fairness.findings: Reports mention unconscious bias training. They also reference efforts to address biases in processes.
fairness.path_to_improvement: Publish bias testing results, outcome monitoring, or vendor fairness certifications.

relevant_sources.summary: The "2022 Corporate Responsibility Report - SightLine Demonstrations" provides evidence for fairness, governance, privacy, and transparency. It supports fairness by mentioning unconscious bias training and efforts to address biases in processes. Governance is evidenced by the Senior Leadership Team acting as a steering committee for sustainability and the mention of proprietary algorithms and vendor oversight for AI technologies like Goodyear SightLine. The report also indicates a commitment to privacy by addressing data privacy concerns related to technology adoption and transparency through the documentation of AI-enabled product capabilities and their underlying algorithmic systems.
relevant_sources.title: 2022 Corporate Responsibility Report - SightLine Demonstrations

governance.findings: SEC filings describe the establishment of an AI Governance Council and outline a formal structure for addressing AI-related risks, including cybersecurity and data privacy, with oversight by committees for risk management. Policy documents establish clear expectations for associates regarding responsible AI use and reference a Generative AI Use Policy. Reports and press releases mention vendor oversight for AI technologies, describe aims for safety in automated systems like Automatic Emergency Braking, and reference the use of calculation models and recommendations.

relevant_sources.summary: This SEC filing, Goodyear's 2024 10-K Annual Report, provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. The establishment of an AI Governance Council, comprised of representatives from various departments, demonstrates a formal, operational structure for addressing AI-related risks, including cybersecurity and data privacy. Furthermore, the oversight by the Board Audit Committee and the Cybersecurity Disclosure Committee highlights established mechanisms for risk management and incident evaluation.
relevant_sources.title: 10-K Annual Report 2024 - Item 1C Cybersecurity

relevant_sources.summary: The "Goodyear SightLine Technology Platform Overview" help page provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. It supports transparency by describing the capabilities of the tire intelligence platform, which measures various tire and road conditions. The document also implies governance by detailing its availability for fleet managers and autonomous systems, suggesting a structured approach to its application and oversight.
relevant_sources.title: Goodyear SightLine Technology Platform Overview

relevant_sources.summary: The "2022 Corporate Responsibility Report - SightLine Demonstrations" provides evidence for fairness, governance, privacy, and transparency. It supports fairness by mentioning unconscious bias training and efforts to address biases in processes. Governance is evidenced by the Senior Leadership Team acting as a steering committee for sustainability and the mention of proprietary algorithms and vendor oversight for AI technologies like Goodyear SightLine. The report also indicates a commitment to privacy by addressing data privacy concerns related to technology adoption and transparency through the documentation of AI-enabled product capabilities and their underlying algorithmic systems.
relevant_sources.title: 2022 Corporate Responsibility Report - SightLine Demonstrations

relevant_sources.summary: This press release, "Goodyear-TNO Automatic Emergency Braking System Integration," provides evidence for **external accountability**, **governance**, and **transparency**. It demonstrates transparency by detailing how tire intelligence enables smarter AEB decision-making and highlights external accountability by positioning the technology as meeting and exceeding regulatory requirements for safety. The press release also implies governance through its aims to predict braking distance and trigger AEB for safety, showcasing a commitment to safety and the role of AEB systems in automated driving.
relevant_sources.title: Goodyear-TNO Automatic Emergency Braking System Integration

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper provides evidence for the governance and transparency pillars of responsible AI. It describes the integration of tire condition and weather data into friction estimation APIs and advisory speed limit models, implying governance through the use of "calculation models" and "recommendations." The mention of "use cases" and "automated adjustment of speed limits" supports transparency by detailing how the system's capabilities and algorithmic decision-making are applied.
relevant_sources.title: NDS Conference - SightLine NDS.Live Integration

relevant_sources.summary: This third-party industry documentation for Goodyear's SightLine technology provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars. The document supports transparency by detailing the AI system's capabilities, data inputs, and functions for estimating tire-road friction, as well as mentioning the use of proprietary algorithms for optimization. It also indicates governance goals through its description of data sophistication and tire evolution aspirations.
relevant_sources.title: Tire Review - Goodyear SightLine Technology Analysis

relevant_sources.summary: This third-party research report, "TNO Research Institute - SightLine AEB Integration Study," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. The study describes an "aim" to predict and trigger Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB) using AI, indicating governance for the safe introduction of automation. Furthermore, it highlights how AI insights enable "precise braking" and "robust performance," suggesting governance over the automated system's actions and "smarter, more precise decision-making."
relevant_sources.title: TNO Research Institute - SightLine AEB Integration Study

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, the "2024 Corporate Responsibility Report - Responsible Use of AI," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar. It establishes clear expectations for associates regarding the responsible and ethical use of AI, referencing a specific "Generative AI Use Policy" for guidance on emerging AI technologies.
relevant_sources.title: 2024 Corporate Responsibility Report - Responsible Use of AI

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.findings: Reports address data privacy concerns related to technology adoption.
privacy.path_to_improvement: Publish AI-specific privacy impact assessments or data handling procedures.

transparency.findings: Documentation describes the capabilities of the tire intelligence platform, including its functions for measuring tire and road conditions and estimating tire-road friction. Reports and press releases detail how AI-enabled product capabilities and underlying algorithmic systems enable smarter decision-making, such as for Automatic Emergency Braking. Technical papers and partnership announcements further describe system functionalities, use cases, and algorithmic decision-making, allowing for an understanding of how the technology operates.

relevant_sources.summary: The "Goodyear SightLine Technology Platform Overview" help page provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. summary.overall_findings: Based on 15 publicly available sources, Goodyear Tire & Rubber's published materials address 4 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. Operational practices are documented for transparency and governance, with disclosures describing the capabilities of the tire intelligence platform and outlining a formal, operational structure for addressing AI-related risks. Additionally, policy-level evidence is present for fairness and privacy, with materials referencing efforts to address biases in processes and addressing data privacy concerns related to technology adoption. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability, oversight, and 1 additional pillar.
